title: Trace: Missing File
story: Trying to open a file that doesn't exist raises FileNotFoundError. This teaches you to handle file I/O errors gracefully.
instructions: Review the stack trace and identify the file operation issue.

hints.text: FileNotFoundError means Python couldn't find the file at the specified path.
Check if the filename is correct and if the file exists in the current directory.

traceReading.stackTrace:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "main.py", line 1, in <module>
    f = open('data.txt', 'r')
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'data.txt'
traceReading.buggyCode:
f = open('data.txt', 'r')
content = f.read()
f.close()
print(content)

questions.question: How can you handle this error gracefully in your code?
questions.correctAnswer: Use try-except to catch FileNotFoundError, or check if file exists with os.path.exists()
